net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.component

Class Menu

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.component.ComponentImpl
      • net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.component.AbstractButton
        • net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.component.MenuItem
          • net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.component.Menu
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cloneable, Iterable<Component>, LocaleContextSource, CardContainerSelector, Component, ListCellRenderer, ParentComponent, TableCellRenderer, TreeCellRenderer

    public class Menu
extends MenuItem
implements ParentComponent

    An implementation of a menu. A menu is basically a button with an associated popup menu. When the button is pressed the popup menu appears.

    This component can be used in two ways. It can be added to a MenuBar and that component determines how to display the top-level menus. It can also be added to a Container and will be displayed as a text button. When clicked the popup menu will open.

    Author:
    Pat B. Double (double@i2rd.com)

      • contains

        public boolean contains(Component com)
        Description copied from interface: ParentComponent
        Check if this component contains the given component. The check is made based on object identity. This method will not traverse deeper than this parent object. For example, if this parent component contains another parent component which contains the argument, the return value will be false.
        Specified by:
        contains in interface ParentComponent
        Parameters:
        com - The component.
        Returns:
        true if the argument is contained in this parent component.

      • getHTMLElement

        public Element getHTMLElement()
        Description copied from interface: Component
        Get the top level elements this component will output in its current state. This should not included the entire content model.

        For example, if your code outputs the following, <p><span><b></b></span></p>, then you should only return one element that is a "p"; NOT "p, span, b".

        All configuration elements should be nested within this top element, or other arrangements should be made with the inner keeper.

        Specified by:
        getHTMLElement in interface Component
        Overrides:
        getHTMLElement in class MenuItem
        Returns:
        the element.

      • init

        public void init()
        Description copied from interface: Component

        Called when a Component is first attached to a WindowManager. This means the Component should have valid return values from getApplication(), getLocaleContext(), getParent(). It is preferable to have all construction of the Component go here since a valid LocaleContext, Application object, etc., are available.

        When overriding this method, be sure to call the super class init(). init() is called only once for each Component. The parent component will have been init()ed before init() is called.

        NOTE: Do not call this method from application code. It is meant to be called by the WindowManager only.

        Specified by:
        init in interface Component
        Overrides:
        init in class AbstractButton

      • preRenderProcess

        public final void preRenderProcess(Request request,
                    Response response,
                    RendererEditorState<?> rendererEditorState)
        Description copied from class: AbstractButton
        Allow the component to process any form fields before rendering. This method must be called by subclasses. Method calls on components, creating or destroying components, or nearly everything else having to do with the component tree and related data models must be done by queuing an event using EventQueue.queue(EventQueueElement). Otherwise you may get unexpected results. Calls AbstractButton.click() on the button and sets the selection path if the renderer state is not null.
        Specified by:
        preRenderProcess in interface Component
        Overrides:
        preRenderProcess in class AbstractButton
        Parameters:
        request - the request.
        response - the response.
        rendererEditorState - the renderer / editor state, will be null if not using as a renderer / editor.
